The possible ways to provide a package.xml file is described in the existing bloom tutorials. The options are

* upstream contains a package.xml file and installs to the location "<prefix>/share/<PKGNAME>"

* the package.xml file is added in the release process (in the case of ROS in the gbp repository), again also adding the install directive

The pros / cons are obvious:

* contained in upstream: any checkout of the sources is buildable - but upstream does not want to include the file

* added during release process: only released versions can be built - upstream does not need to include the file but must add it during the repeated release process

* provided via separate download: requires user knowledge and interaction - the upstream project does not have to deal with its
